titleStmt.title: To JAMES SANER,James Saner, M.D., surgeon; medical officer to the Eagle Insurance Company. Died 1860, aged 81. CD was applying to the Eagle Insurance Company at this time before travelling to America: see To John Forster, [?13 Nov 1841], in Pilgrim Letters 2, p. 420, in which the reference to "sapient saner" was either a play on the name of Saner, the Company's medical officer, or a simple reference to the outcome of his medical check by the "knowledgeable" or "wise" ("sapient") James Saner. [?MID NOVEMBER 1841]
titleStmt.bibl: Charles Dickens Letters Project, ed. Leon Litvack, Katie Brandt, Emily Bell, and Jeremy Parrott (London: Dickens Fellowship), DickensLetters.com.
